intro: Bothriopodium glaziovii var. begoniifolium, commonly known as the Begonia-leaved Bolete, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, begonia-like leaves that are broad and lobed, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it prefers specific soil and climate conditions to flourish.
